    Evaluates the last knot in the curve.
    Transform2 Transform2.flipX()
    Flips the transform's scale on the horizontal axis, i.e., negates the scale's x component.
    Transform2 Transform2.flipY()
    Flips the transform's scale on the vertical axis, i.e., negates the scale's y component.

    A helper function to set the transform's from either separate vectors or from the columns of a matrix.

    Creates a random transform.
    Transform2 Transform2.revert()
    Reverts this transform to its previous state, i.e., swaps current location, rotation and scale with the previous.
    Transform2 Transform2.rotateTo​(float rotNew)
    Rotates the transform to an angle in radians, then updates its axes.
    Transform2 Transform2.rotateTo​(float radians, float step)
    Rotates the transform to a new orientation by a step in [0.0, 1.0] .
    Transform2 Transform2.rotateTo​(float radians, float step, Utils.PeriodicEasing easingFunc)
    Rotates the transform to a new orientation by a step in [0.0, 1.0] using the specified easing function.
    Transform2 Transform2.rotateZ​(float radians)
    Rotates this transform around the z axis by an angle in radians, then updates the transform's axes.
    Transform2 Transform2.scaleBy​(float scalar)
    Scales the transform by a uniform scalar.

    Scales the transform to a uniform size.

    Sets a transform's rotation to the given axes.
    Transform2 Transform2.wrap​(Vec2 lb, Vec2 ub)
    Wraps the transform's location around a periodic range as defined by an upper and lower bound: lower bounds inclusive; upper bounds exclusive.

    Centers the curve about the origin, (0.0, 0.0), and rescales it to the range [-0.5, 0.5] .

    Promotes a 2D transform to a 3D transform.
    Curve2 Curve2.toOrigin​(Transform2 tr)
    Centers the curve about the origin, (0.0, 0.0), by calculating its dimensions then subtracting the center point.
    Mesh2 Mesh2.toOrigin​(Transform2 tr)
    Centers the mesh about the origin, (0.0, 0.0), by calculating its dimensions then subtracting the center point.
    Curve2 Curve2.transform​(Transform2 tr)
    Transforms all coordinates in the curve permanently by a transform.

    Not to be confused with the temporary transformations applied by a curve entity's transform to the meshes contained within the entity.

    Useful when consolidating multiple curve entities into one curve entity.
    Edge2 Edge2.transform​(Transform2 tr)
    Transforms this edge by a transform.
    Face2 Face2.transform​(Transform2 tr)
    Transforms all coordinates in the face by a transform.
    Knot2 Knot2.transform​(Transform2 tr)
    Multiplies this knot by a transform.
    Mesh2 Mesh2.transform​(Transform2 tr)
    Transforms all coordinates in the mesh permanently by a transform.

    Not to be confused with the temporary transformations applied by a mesh entity's transform to the meshes contained within the entity.

    Useful when consolidating multiple mesh entities into one mesh entity.
